title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.52 - Executive order no. 52: establishing the forest resources development council
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.52 - Executive order no. 52: establishing the forest resources development council

State Regulations
WHEREAS, New York State recognizes the importance of the
forest products industry and values its contributions and economic potential to
the State; WHEREAS, the forest products industry encompasses a
spectrum of businesses and industries that are interdependent and rely on
available, growing, and renewable forest resources and thus the overall well
being of this industry is dependent on the health of each of its parts; and
WHEREAS, the Department of Economic Development has
requested that the Forest Industry prepare a Blueprint for Growing the Forest

Products Industry in New York State; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby establish the New York State Forest

Resources Development Council. I. Membership

The New York State Forest Resources Development Council
shall include the Commissioners of Economic Development and Environmental

Conservation or their designees and up to twenty members representing the
interests of the forest products industry or interested in the forest resources
of New York State. The Council shall be chaired by a private sector member of
industry selected by the Governor. The Council will seek the Governor's
approval to appoint new members and/or to accept resignations of current
members. the members of the Council shall receive no compensation but shall be
entitled to reimbursement for any necessary expenses incurred in connection
with the performance of their duties. II. Duties and Responsibilities of the

Council
1. The Council shall advise the

Governor and the executive agencies on (a) ways to foster the growth and
retention of forest products businesses in the State and (b) on actions to
improve the environmental and economic contributions of the State's largest
natural resource, its forests. 2. The Council shall work with the executive agencies to respond to the
recommendations in the Blueprint for Growing the Forest Products Industry in

New York State. 3. On or about

December 1, 1997, and every two years thereafter, the Council shall submit a
report and/or a revised Blueprint for Growing the Forest Products Industry in

New York State to the Governor and executive agencies. III. Assistance and Cooperation

The New York State Department of Economic Development and
the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation shall provide staff
and support to the Council. All other departments, divisions and units of State
government, are directed to cooperate with the Council and to provide such
assistance as it may require to fulfill its purpose. Such assistance may
include, but is not limited to, assignment of agency staff and the provisions
of such statistical and program data as the Council may require. Signed: George E. PatakiDated: May 13, 1997
[FN*] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 9 (David A. Paterson), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra.]
